column3:
Maybe now isn't the best time for you to see her, Mr. Dresden.
I glanced up at the clock on the wall. It was five minutes before eight. "She wanted me early." I stepped to one side to go around him.

At five minutes to eight, the Prime Minister emerged from Wilsonâ€™s office, followed by Halifax and Cadogan. Wilson was the last to appear. He looked irritated. Legat guessed he must have had a further argument with Cadogan.
at 7.55 this morning the circus ran away to join me.
